sub_title: CEO and Founder Kantisto BV; Assoc. Prof. Analytical Pharmaceutical Chemistry at Uppsala Universitet;
summary:
Founder and Managing Director of Kantisto BV, a pharmaceutical analytical consultancy, see www.kantisto.nl. Analytical Chemist with scientific and line-management background and many years experience within the international pharmaceutical industry. Good knowledge of the CMC drug development process. Recognized for technical leadership and people management, network and team building, drive, enthusiasm, conceptual and analytical thinking, knowledge sharing, problem solving, implementation and ease to interact with cultural differences. Stimulates others to make pragmatic decisions on scientifically sound grounds. Strives to develop people and get the best out of every team member.

Key expertise areas:
-	Scientific coaching
-	Analytical Quality by Design (AQbD) implementation and training
-	Bridging Analytical Science and Regulatory Science
-	Capillary Electrophoresis

Associate Professor Analytical Pharmaceutical Chemistry at Uppsala University, Sweden
Adjunct Senior Lecturer at ACROSS School of Chemistry, Hobart, Tasmania, Australia

Voluntary scientific activities: 
- Chair of the EDQM European Pharmacopoeia Capillary Electrophoresis Expert Group
- President SAC KNCV (Section of Analytical Chemistry, Royal Dutch Society of Chemistry)
- Director and Board Member of CASSS
- Committee member Analytical Technologies Europe since 2015, chair 2015 and 2016
- Co- chair CE in the Biotechnology & Pharmaceutical Industries CEPharm 2010 and CEPharm 2011
- Symposium Organizing Committee Member CEPharm 2003 – 2004, 2007 – 2016
- Organizing committee EuroAnalysis 2021
- Organizing symposia and lecturing short courses
- Examiner and/or Supervisor of MSc and PhD students of universities in NL, S, UK, D, B
- Reviewer for scientific journals
- Editor Electrophoresis journal

awards:
[{'title': 'CEPharm Award', 'description': 'The CE Pharm Award aims to recognize and award an individual with sustained and significant contribution to the practical application of CE to the analysis of Biotechnology and Pharmaceutical products. See also: http://www.casss.org/news/260306/Dr.-Cari-Snger-van-de-Griend-named-2015-CE-Pharm-Award-winner.htm

"This year’s winner, Cari Sänger can de Griend, has been described as a spider in the CE knowledge web. She continues to be a tireless advocate for scientifically sound CE method development, and for the use of CE to assure the quality of pharmaceutical products. She regularly networks with academic leaders in CE and pharmaceutical CE users to ensure there is a robust community exchange of ideas."

Past Recipients of the “CE Pharm Award”:
2014- Michel Girard - Health Canada 
2013- András Guttman – Northeastern University
2012- Franka Kálmán- University of Applies Sciences Western Switzerland
2011- Oscar Salas-Solano- Seattle Genetics, Inc.
2010-  SungAe Park- Amgen, Inc.
2009-  Stacey Ma- Genentech, Inc.
2008-  Anthony Chen and Wassim Nashabeh- Genentech, Inc.
2007-  Kevin Altria- GlaxoSmithKline
2006-  Norberto Guzman- Johnson & Johnson', 'issuer': 'CASSS CE in the Biotechnology & Pharmaceutical Industries Scientific Committee', 'date': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}]

[{'company': {'id': 1962785, 'name': 'Kantisto Separation Sciences', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQFOg-VfLzrFaQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1519862048492?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=aHd3cDgFvxOxzE4FGfsG_K2WvJJIpnF_ljNjby7x7T0', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/kantisto-separation-sciences/', 'employees': {'start': 0, 'end': 1}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Baarn, the Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Kantisto Separation Sciences', 'description': 'Kantisto BV is an independent chemical and pharmaceutical analysis consultancy. Kantisto offers support in practical and strategic issues through long or short-term assignments. Kantisto also provides in-company training and courses. Based in the Netherlands, Kantisto delivers its services in Europe and throughout the world. Kantisto can support you with practical technical issues, quality by design (QbD), analytical QbD and also with documentation for regulatory approval such as IMPD/IND, MAA/NDA and SOPs. A focus on knowledge transfer and implementation means that Kantisto prefers to work not just for you, but with you on-site, in close cooperation and collaboration, with a pragmatic scientific and personal approach. Keywords are:
•	(On-site) Trainings and courses 
•	Scientific supervision and coaching
•	Method and application development, validation and transfer
•	QbD and Analytical QbD
•	Writing or reviewing of SOPs, CMC Module 3 and other regulatory documentation
•	Troubleshooting and application improvement
•	E-learning tools
•	Teaching and lecturing, supervision of students
•	Capillary Electrophoresis expertise

Combined training and consultancy
Especially in early adaptation of a technique that is new within a department or company, consultancy and training are hard to differentiate. It is most effective in such cases to go by an intensive trajectory of combined teaching and coaching. Such a trajectory can comprise:
•	Classroom discussion of the basic fundamental properties of the technique
•	Getting started on the on-site equipment
•	Translate the just learned fundamentals and good working practices for projects at hand
•	Interpretation of the results and planning of further experiments
•	Continued coaching by telcons, webex meetings, site visits and advanced classroom trainings 

(On-site) Courses and Trainings, both tailor-made and open-registration courses.
